messages.message: On UAT, in the Hub, with an app preview open, the close *X* isn't aligned properly.

i think the alignment is correct?

do you think it’s mis-aligned because the scrollbar is on the right and the `X` isn’t aligned with the scrollbar?
The click target for the X is too small. You have to have your cursor aligned juuuuust right to get a clickable area.

In the video, you see I didn't even find the clickable area for the first app I opened, and clicked outside the modal instead to close it. Then I accidentally found the clickable area on the second app.

ah i didn’t watch until the end of the video :sweat:

so strange! i can reproduce on aihub-uat, but the close button works as expected on aihub-sandbox
unfortunately, i can also reproduce on aihub.preprod.instabase.com (http://aihub.preprod.instabase.com) and aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com) :notlikeblob:
@Weiming Wu @Paul H @Jessica have you guys seen this before?

I have a fix up for this, I just need to merge the backport! There were some other issues in this modal that I fixed, and it turns out that when you take out the header, the body of the modal goes over the x button
I think we might want a pollen fix too - making the z index of the x button higher than the modal content
cc @Liam Callanan on the z index of the x button ^
I fixed it by adding back an empty header:
If trivial, can we also look at center-aligning the 'published by' text?
Ah yeah that does not look great, I'll fix
